alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Gilmer; Murray; Towns; Union (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 4:50PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE OVER NORTHEAST GEORGIA FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING... ...VERY COLD AND BLUSTERY CONDITIONS EXPECTED FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY... A fast moving storm system may bring scattered light precipitation Friday over parts of northeast Georgia. As very cold air moves in behind the system, some of the precipitation may mix with or change to light snow Friday afternoon. At this time, any snow accumulations are expected to be very light, less than a quarter of an inch. Behind the storm system, very cold temperatures, the coldest so far this winter, will push into northeast Georgia Friday night and Saturday. Temperatures will fall to 10 to 15 degrees and northwest winds will gust up to 40 mph, resulting in wind chill values from 5 above zero to 10 below zero. Temperatures will moderate into the mid 20s to mid 30s and winds will diminish by Saturday afternoon. Stay tuned for the latest updates. Use caution and dress appropriately if you plan to be outdoors Friday night and Saturday morning. Prolonged exposure may lead to frostbite or hypothermia.
